intro: Gravesia nigrescens, commonly known as the black-flowered gravesia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking dark purple to black flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy texture. The flowers are often fragrant and bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
